info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued September 10 at 1:42PM PDT until September 10 at 3:00PM PDT by NWS LasVegas
info.description: ...FLASH FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 3 PM MST/3 PM PDT/ THIS AFTERNOON FOR NORTH CENTRAL MOHAVE AND NORTHEASTERN CLARK COUNTIES... At 142 PM MST /142 PM PDT/, Doppler radar indicated thunderstorms producing heavy rain across the warned area. Rainfall rates of one inch per hour will be possible with these storms. Additional rainfall in areas with high soil moisture levels from morning showers will be vulnerable to rapid onset flash flooding. Flash flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly. HAZARD...Life-threatening flash flooding. Thunderstorms producing flash flooding. SOURCE...Radar. IMPACT...Life-threatening flash flooding of low-water crossings, creeks, normally dry washes and roads. Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Mesquite, Beaver Dam, Littlefield and Bunkerville. FLASH FLOOD...RADAR INDICATED FLASH FLOOD DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE EXPECTED RAINFALL RATE...1 INCH IN 1 HOUR
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
